SEARCH
Package org.hms.services.authentication

Class AuthenticationService

java.lang.Object
org.hms.services.authentication.AuthenticationService
public class AuthenticationService extends Object
The AuthenticationService class provides functionalities for user authentication, user management, and password management. This class manages user login, password changes, account locking due to failed login attempts, and various user-related operations including adding, deleting, and searching users.

  • Constructor Details

    • AuthenticationService

      public AuthenticationService()
      Constructs an instance of AuthenticationService and initializes its internal state. This includes setting up the user storage mechanism, tracking login attempts, and loading users from a persistent storage.

      The constructor performs the following operations: - Initializes the users map to store user information. - Sets up an instance of LoginAttemptTracker for managing login attempts and account lockouts. - Calls initializeUserDatabase to set up the user database if it doesn't exist. - Calls loadUsers to load existing user information from the database into memory.

  • Method Details

    • login

      public AuthenticationResult login(String id, String password)
      Authenticates a user with the provided ID and password. This method performs several checks, including verifying user existence, account lock status, and password correctness. If authentication is successful, the user's login attempts are cleared and they are set as the current user.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the user attempting to log in.
      password - The password provided by the user for authentication.
      Returns:
      An AuthenticationResult object representing the outcome of the authentication attempt.

    • changePassword

      public boolean changePassword(String oldPassword, String newPassword)
      Changes the password for the currently logged-in user.
      Parameters:
      oldPassword - the current password of the user
      newPassword - the new password to be set
      Returns:
      true if the password was successfully changed, false otherwise

    • logout

      public void logout()
      Logs out the current user by setting the currentUser field to null.

      This method is typically called when a user chooses to log out from the system. After calling this method, no user will be considered as logged in until a subsequent login operation is successfully performed.

    • getCurrentUser

      public User getCurrentUser()
      Retrieves the current authenticated user.
      Returns:
      the current User object, or null if no user is authenticated

    • addUser

      public String addUser(UserRole role)
      Adds a new user to the system with the specified role.
      Parameters:
      role - the role assigned to the new user
      Returns:
      the unique identifier of the newly added user

    • addUserWithId

      public boolean addUserWithId(String id, UserRole role)
      Adds a new user with the specified ID and role.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier for the new user
      role - the role assigned to the new user
      Returns:
      true if the user was added successfully, false if a user with the given ID already exists

    • getAllUsers

      public List<User> getAllUsers()
      Retrieves a list of all users currently in the system.
      Returns:
      a List containing all User objects

    • getUsersByRole

      public List<User> getUsersByRole(UserRole role)
      Fetches a list of users filtered by their specified role.
      Parameters:
      role - The role used as a filter criterion to retrieve users.
      Returns:
      A list of users that have the specified role.

    • getUsersByRole

      public List<User> getUsersByRole(UserRole role, boolean sortById)
      Retrieves a list of Users by their role, with an option to sort them by their ID.
      Parameters:
      role - the role of the users to retrieve
      sortById - flag indicating whether the result should be sorted by user ID
      Returns:
      a list of users with the specified role, optionally sorted by user ID

    • searchUsersByIdPrefix

      public List<User> searchUsersByIdPrefix(String idPrefix)
      Searches for users whose IDs start with the given prefix.
      Parameters:
      idPrefix - the prefix to search for in user IDs
      Returns:
      a list of users whose IDs start with the provided prefix

    • userExists

      public boolean userExists(String id)
      Checks if a user with the specified ID exists in the user database.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier for the user
      Returns:
      true if the user exists, false otherwise

    • deleteUser

      public boolean deleteUser(String id)
      Deletes a user identified by the given ID from the user database.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the user to be deleted.
      Returns:
      true if the user was successfully deleted, false if the user does not exist.

    • getUser

      public Optional<User> getUser(String id)
      Retrieves a user by their unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the user to retrieve
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the user if found, otherwise an empty Optional

    • getUserCount

      Retrieves the total number of users currently present in the system.

      the total count of users
